results.title: Time to remember: 1915 - your country needs you
results.brief_description: An outline of World War I events during 1915, showing the trench warfare from the North Sea to the Alps, the Dardanelles and Gallipoli, the building of the new British volunteer army by Lord Kitchener and its baptism of fire at Loos. Narrated by Stanley Holloway. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Time to learn
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Office of Intellectual Disability Services. Early Intervention Resource Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Early Intervention Series”.
This program is for all professionals who come into contact with young children with multiple disabilities. The issues explored are: The Impact of the diagnosis at birth. The impact of delayed diagnosis. The importance of the relationship between the child, parent and professionals. How therapists work with families. * Difficult behaviours. Family Stress. Respite care.

results.title: Time to grow
results.creator_credit: Tasmania. Directorate of Industrial Development and Trade, Don Anderson and Rodney Musch
results.brief_description: Shows some of the agricultural activities which form the basis of Tasmania’s economy, including dairying, beef cattle and sheep. Emphasises the need for increasing intensification of efficiency in farming methods as the world population rapidly increases.

results.title: Time to go John
results.creator_credit: Catherine Gough-Brody, Jen Hughes, John Pierce, Philippa Campey, Kate McCarthy, Keren Flavell, Andrea Foxworthy, Carmela Baranowska, H T Lee and Various
results.brief_description: A compilation of short films put together and distributed just before the Australian Federal Government election in 2004. An anti-John Howard work summarising the controversial aspects of the Prime Minister’s time in office up to that point: covers issues such as the War in Iraq, Anti-Terrorist Laws, Reconciliation, Mandatory Detention, GST, East Timor, Territorial Waters with East Timor, Refugees, Australian Muslims and the Trade Union Waterfront dispute. Made in just eight weeks with no budget (and no government funding!) this irreverent outpouring of anger and political opinion is an absolute testament to the dedication of the filmmakers (and a real test for possible sedition laws). Controversial but fine filmmaking with a mixture of animation, documentaries and satire. Presented by comedian and activist Rod Quantock.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Catherine Gough-Brody, Jen Hughes, John Pierce, Philippa Campey, Kate McCarthy, Keren Flavell, Andrea Foxworthy, Carmela Baranowska, H T Lee and Various

results.title: Time scrambler
results.creator_credit: H Simons, Landmark Films, Pawel Kuczynski and Henriette Simons
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading planet”.
The Time Scrambler has locked five students into a lost time frame. Designed to teach students to use a time line and to recognise sequencing cues in the reading selections. Tells how Prism, an 11 year old alien/teacher instructs his earth students in time sequence when the students become confused about the sequence of events in a story.

results.title: Time regained [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Gemini Films, France 2 Cinema, Les Films du Lendemain, Paolo Branco and Raul Ruiz
results.brief_description: Confined to bed in his small apartment, Marcel Proust, is looking through old photos. As faded pictures jog his memory, real characters of his past intermingle with fictional ones from his novels. Proust’s world is like an interconnected gossip column penned by a rich intellectual snob with a refined sense of the comic, for whom music, painting, and literature in particular matter far more than society. The lost paradise of his childhood gives way to literary salons in Paris. To evoke the vast human comedy that surrounded and supported Proust, director Raul Ruiz blends the Baroque and the Surreal, creating a story like a series of corridors leading to the images, themes and stories which coursed through Proust’s novels. ‘Time Regained’ can be at times disconcerting for those not familar with Proust’s work, as Ruiz chose to have characters glide in and out of the story without formal introduction. In the spreading twilight, the shape of post-war society looms on the horizon. Proust died in 1922, but by the end of WWI most of his world had already vanished. Stars Catherine Deneuve, Vincent Perez, Emmanuelle Beart, John Malkovitch. Adapted from ‘Remembrance Of Things Past’ by Marcel Proust. In French with English subtitles. Reference: Ron Holloway. ‘Time Regained’. Cannes Internatinal Film Festival. Online. http://www.filmfestivals.com/cannes99/html/seloff11.htm
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gemini Films, France 2 Cinema, Les Films du Lendemain, Paolo Branco and Raul Ruiz

results.title: Time piece
results.brief_description: Combines comedy and serious commentary to show one person’s life in the urban rat race. Portrays the hero, a typical young executive, as he is hospitalised and his daily life tasks flash before his eyes, alternating between realism and wild dreams. Starring Jim Henson and Enid Cafritz. Animated by Jim Henson.

results.title: Time piece
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Colin Low and Albert Kish
results.brief_description: Examples of restoration projects undertaken by Canada’s National Historic Sites Service. Fort Louisbourg, painstakingly rebuilt to its former imposing dimensions on Nova Scotia’s Cape Breton coast; near Winnipeg, a century-old Hudson’s Bay Company trading post; in Kingston, the home of Sir John A. Macdonald; and famous Dawson City, are some of the many places and mementos of the past vividly brought to life in this film.
